newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Avis Europe sets share price at 124p/share.
newsitem.headline: Avis Europe sets share price at 124p/share.

text.p: Car rental firm Avis Europe, 77.1 percent owned by Belgian car importer D'Ieteren, said on Wednesday its share offer had been heavily oversubscribed and would be priced at 124 pence per share.
It said conditional dealings in the shares would start today, with unconditional dealings starting on April 4.
A total of 215 million shares will be issued, raising an estimated 267 million pounds sterling, Avis said in a statement.
At a price of 124 pence per share, the total value of the issued ordinary share capital of the firm is 722 million pounds saterling.

Avis said that in view of the weight of oversubscription of the share offer, retail investors would receive 725 shares in respect of the first 1,000 pounds of their demand plus 10 percent of the difference between their demand and 1,000 pounds.
As part of the offer, D'Ieteren has granted Merrill Lynch an option to buy 30 million existing shares in Avis.
If this is exercised in full, D'Ieteren's share of Avis Europe will fall to 57 percent.
